name: myCred for WP-PostViews
author: myCRED

sections.description:
WP-PostViews enables you to display how many times a post/page had been viewed. This plugin allows you to reward post authors for each view they receive with myCred points.

myCred for WP-PostViews Features

Here are the most notable features of myCred for WP-PostViews.

  • Award points for post views.
  • Badge support.
  • Translation ready.

Plugin Requirements

  • myCred 1.8+
  • WP-PostViews
  • WordPress 5.0+
  • PHP 5.3+

More myCred Freebies Integrations

  • myCred H5P
  • myCred Credly
  • myCred – Learndash
  • LifterLMS Plugin Integration with myCred
  • myCred BP Group Leaderboards
  • myCred for Event Espresso 4.6+
  • myCred for Wp-Pro-Quiz
  • myCred for Rating Form
  • myCred Birthdays
  • myCred for TotalPoll
  • myCred Gutenberg
  • myCred for Events Manager Pro
  • myCred for BuddyPress Compliments
  • myCred Retro
  • myCred for Courseware
  • myCred for GD Star Rating
  • myCred for BuddyPress Links
  • myCred for BP Album and BP Gallery
  • myCred Elementor

DOCUMENTATION AND SUPPORT

For more information visit our Documentation Page.
sections.installation:
1. Go to Plugins > Add New.
  2. Under Search, type myCred for WP-PostViews
  3. Find myCred for WP-PostViews and click Install Now to install it
  4. If successful, click Activate Plugin to activate it and you are ready to go.
sections.changelog:
1.1

New – Compatible with WordPress Version 6.6.1.

1.0.9

New – Code improvement.

1.0.8

New – Compatible with WordPress Version 6.5.2.

1.0.7

TWEAK – Added compatibility for the myCred v2.6.

1.0.6

New – Compatible with WordPress Version 6.2.2.

1.0.5

New – Compatible with WordPress Version 5.8.1.

1.0.4

Improvement – Get plugin updates from wordpress.org

1.0.3

Compatible with WordPress 5.0.3.
NEW – Added support for myCred 1.8.
Tested with myCred 1.8.

1.0.2

FIX – Settings not getting saved on certain setups.
When updating to this version, make sure you remove the hook from the active sidebar, refresh the page and then re-enable the hook!

1.0.1

FIX – Reference issue when the WP Postviews plugin is disabled and this plugin is still enabled.

1.0

Initial release
